channel.title: Number 10 Podcast
channel.description: Welcome to the Number 10 Podcast where you'll hear Prime Minister's questions plus exclusive features and interviews from 10 Downing Street and the Prime Minister.
channel.itunes:author: Prime Minister's Office
channel.itunes:keywords: Downing Street, Number Ten, Number 10, Prime Minister

item.title: Prime Minister's New Year podcast
item.description: A podcast by Prime Minister David Cameron recorded at the end of 2010 and looking ahead to 2011.
item.itunes:summary: A podcast by Prime Minister David Cameron recorded at the end of 2010 and looking ahead to 2011.
item.itunes:keywords: prime minister, david cameron, new year, budget, economy, national security, public services, coalition

item.title: Prime Minister's Podcast 23 October 2010
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron's podcast on the Spending Review.
item.itunes:subtitle: Building economic growth and jobs
item.itunes:summary: Prime Minister David Cameron's podcast on the Spending Review.
item.itunes:keywords: Spending Review, economy, jobs, growth, David Cameron

item.title: Press conference with Prime Minister Singh
item.description: A press conference given by Prime Minister David Cameron and Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh in Delhi, India, on 29 July 2010.
item.itunes:summary: A press conference given by Prime Minister David Cameron and Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh in Delhi, India, on 29 July 2010.

item.title: PM at UK/India economic summit
item.description: The PM and other Government ministers at a UK/India economic summit in Delhi, India.
item.itunes:summary: The PM and other Government ministers at a UK/India economic summit in Delhi, India.
item.itunes:keywords: Prime Minister, David Cameron, India, economy

item.title: PM's speech in Bangalore, India
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron has given a speech setting out his aim to strengthen the UK-India relationship and promote increased trade and investment.
item.itunes:summary: Prime Minister David Cameron has given a speech setting out his aim to strengthen the UK-India relationship and promote increased trade and investment.
item.itunes:keywords: David Cameron, Prime Minister, India, Infosys, trade

item.title: Press conference with PM Erdogan
item.description: A joint press conference given by Prime Minister David Cameron and Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Ankara, Turkey.
item.itunes:summary: A joint press conference given by Prime Minister David Cameron and Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Ankara, Turkey.
item.itunes:keywords: Prime Minister, David Cameron, Turkey, Prime Minister Erdogan, Recep Tayyip Erdogan

item.title: PM's speech in Ankara, Turkey
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron has said he will fight for Turkey to become a member of the European Union as he addressed business leaders in the country’s capital Ankara.
item.itunes:summary: Prime Minister David Cameron has said he will fight for Turkey to become a member of the European Union as he addressed business leaders in the country’s capital Ankara.
item.itunes:keywords: Turkey, European Union, EU, Prime Minister, David Cameron

item.title: Prime Minister's Questions 21 July 2010
item.description: Afghanistan, pensioners and benefits were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.
item.itunes:summary: Afghanistan, pensioners and benefits were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.

item.title: Prime Minister's Questions 14 July 2010
item.description: Northern Ireland, small businesses and treatment for cancer patients were on the agenda at today’s PMQs. The Prime Minister also took questions on unemployment, schools and Afghanistan.
item.itunes:summary: Northern Ireland, small businesses and treatment for cancer patients were on the agenda at today’s PMQs. The Prime Minister also took questions on unemployment, schools and Afghanistan.

item.title: Prime Minister's Questions 30 June 2010
item.description: Unemployment, prison places and Afghanistan were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.
item.itunes:summary: Unemployment, prison places and Afghanistan were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.

item.title: PM Direct - Leeds
item.description: As part of the Cabinet visit to Yorkshire the Prime Minister hosted a Q&A session at Leeds Trinity University College with readers of the Yorkshire Post.
item.itunes:summary: As part of the Cabinet visit to Yorkshire the Prime Minister hosted a Q&A session at Leeds Trinity University College with readers of the Yorkshire Post.

item.title: Prime Minister's Questions 23 June 2010
item.description: State pensions, tax credits and child poverty were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.
item.itunes:summary: State pensions, tax credits and child poverty were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.

item.title: Prime Minister's Questions 16 June 2010
item.description: Unemployment, prisoners and Stansted Airport were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.The Prime Minister also took questions on cancer treatment, knife crime and higher education.
item.itunes:summary: Unemployment, prisoners and Stansted Airport were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.The Prime Minister also took questions on cancer treatment, knife crime and higher education.

item.title: Statement on the Saville Inquiry
item.description: 15 June 2010. The Prime Minister has formally announced the publication of the Bloody Sunday Inquiry report.
item.itunes:summary: 15 June 2010. The Prime Minister has formally announced the publication of the Bloody Sunday Inquiry report.

item.title: Prime Minister's Questions 9 June 2010
item.description: The electoral register, gun laws and services for cancer patients were on the agenda at today’s PMQs. The Prime Minister also took questions on NHS targets, social housing and CCTV surveillance.
item.itunes:summary: The electoral register, gun laws and services for cancer patients were on the agenda at today’s PMQs. The Prime Minister also took questions on NHS targets, social housing and CCTV surveillance.

item.title: Prime Minister's Questions 2 June 2010
item.description: The Gaza blockade, public sector spending and Afghanistan were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.
item.itunes:summary: The Gaza blockade, public sector spending and Afghanistan were on the agenda at today’s PMQs.

item.title: The Prime Minister's Podcast 29 May 2010
item.description: 29 May 2010. The first podcast from David Cameron.
item.itunes:summary: 29 May 2010. The first podcast from David Cameron.
